summary: An FBI briefing memo dated October 8, 2019, providing an update on the Epstein investigation. It notes limitations in digital evidence analysis due to a taint team review, schedules for attorney proffers involving co-conspirators, and the identification of approximately 80 victims with hundreds more unidentified.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of an attorney proffer scheduled for October 8, 2019, as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities.

events.title: Attorney Proffer
events.description: An attorney proffer was conducted, likely related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Attorney Proffer
events.description: An attorney proffer session was scheduled for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Attorney Proffer
events.description: An attorney proffer was scheduled to take place.

events.title: Co-conspirator Attorney Proffer
events.description: An attorney proffer session was scheduled for a co-conspirator.

keyFacts: Digital evidence analysis was limited at the time due to an ongoing review by a taint team.
Approximately 80 victims had been identified, with hundreds more unidentified.
Attorney proffer sessions were scheduled for Ghislaine Maxwell and other co-conspirators on specific dates in October 2019.
Two victim briefings were scheduled to take place in Miami and New York City.
